definition.name: Notion Burndown Chart
definition.description: Generates Burndown Chart based on Scrum backlog in Notion database

inputs.name: NOTION_DB_BACKLOG
inputs.description: Notion Database ID of Sprint Backlog

inputs.name: NOTION_DB_SPRINT_SUMMARY
inputs.description: Notion Database ID of Sprint Summary

inputs.name: NOTION_DB_DAILY_SUMMARY
inputs.description: Notion Database ID of Daily Summary

inputs.name: NOTION_PROPERTY_SPRINT
inputs.description: Name of the property with the sprint number

inputs.name: NOTION_PROPERTY_ESTIMATE
inputs.description: Name of the property with the estimate

inputs.name: NOTION_PROPERTY_PATTERN_STATUS_EXCLUDE
inputs.description: Regex of the statuses of stories which are done

inputs.name: INCLUDE_WEEKENDS
inputs.description: True if weekends should be included in the chart, false otherwise.

inputs.name: SPRINT_START
inputs.description: True if it is the start of a new sprint, false otherwise. When true, a new entry will be created in the Sprint Summary database, and the sprint end date will be 14 days later (sprint start day excluded). Note that new sprint summary will not be created if today is still in the middle of the last sprint.

evidence.reasoning: The action generates a burndown chart, which is primarily a documentation tool for tracking progress in Scrum, while also serving a communication purpose for team updates. It may involve monitoring project progress as well.
